ch.dermitza.securenio.socket.timeout.worker

Class TimeoutWorker

  • java.lang.Object
    • ch.dermitza.securenio.socket.timeout.worker.TimeoutWorker
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable

    public class TimeoutWorker
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Runnable
    A threaded implementation of a worker processing Timeouts required by the AbstractSelector.

    The worker processes timeouts in an expiration-based FIFO fashion. Every existing Timeout is being waited upon until either cancelled or expired. If a timeout expires, the Timeout.expired() method is called on that timeout.

    Every insertion or removal of Timeouts causes the TimeoutWorker to wake up from waiting, recalculate the shortest timeout to wait for, and go back to sleep. The TimeoutWorker is otherwise waiting for incoming tasks via the insert(Timeout) method.

    Since:
    0.18

    • Constructor Detail

      • TimeoutWorker

        public TimeoutWorker()

    • Method Detail

      • insert

        public void insert(Timeout timeout)
        Insert a Timeout that needs to be waited upon. Every Timeout insertion causes the TimeoutWorker to wake up from waiting, recalculate the shortest timeout to wait for, and go back to sleep.

        This implementation is thread-safe.

        Parameters:
        timeout - The Timeout to be waited upon.

      • cancel

        public void cancel(Timeout timeout)
        Cancel an already waited-on Timeout. Every Timeout removal causes the TimeoutWorker to wake up from waiting, recalculate the shortest timeout to wait for, and go back to sleep.

        This implementation is thread-safe.

        Parameters:
        timeout - The timeout to cancel

      • isRunning

        public boolean isRunning()
        Check whether the TimeoutWorker is running.

        This implementation is thread-safe.

        Returns:
        true if it is running, false otherwise

      • setRunning

        public void setRunning(boolean running)
        Set the running status of the TimeoutWorker. If the running status of the worker is set to false, the TimeoutWorker is interrupted (if waiting for a task) in order to cleanly shutdown.

        This implementation is thread-safe.

        Parameters:
        running - Whether the TaskWorker should run

      • run

        public void run()
        The run() method of the TimeoutWorker. Here, every existing Timeout is being waited upon until either cancelled or expired. If a timeout expires, the Timeout.expired() method is called on that timeout.

        Every insertion or removal of Timeouts causes the TimeoutWorker to wake up from waiting, recalculate the shortest timeout to wait for, and go back to sleep.

        Specified by:
        run in interface java.lang.Runnable
